result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kayla Schultz

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 17, 2023 at 11:00 am.

1:31 PM Defendant Kayla Schultz in court.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Kayla Schultz.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Menden requests a new plea and sentencing date in this matter and states reasons on the record. 
State has no comment.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 11:00 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kayla Schultz in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  
Attorney Menden requests another hearing date.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key with the exception that a 3rd party relative may pick up the defendant's belongings at Pick N Save.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

Defendant's appearance was excused.
Statement by Defense.
No objection by the State.
Court orders conditions of bond modified to allow a 3rd party relative to pick up the defendant's belongings at Pick N Save.
Defendant to sign amended bond.  Hearing set for 7/11/22 to remain on as previously scheduled.

Bail/bond hearing on May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on July 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:51 AM Defendant Kayla Schultz in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense indicates her client would like to be able to pick up her belongings at work(Pick N Save) but cannot due to bail restrictions.  Court adjourns bail motion to next week. Court will excuse defendant for bail hearing.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
